text: Airon-Saint-Vaast is a commune in the Pas-de-Calais department in northern France. ==Geography== A small village situated some 19 miles (30 km) south of Boulogne-sur-Mer, on the D143E1 road ==Population== ==Sights== * The church, built in 1877, in Neo-Gothic style. * The chapel de Bavemont, built in 1809. This is where Saint Josse is said to have restored the sight of a little girl (Juliule), on his return from a pilgrimage to Rome in 665. In memory of this, a pilgrimage takes place at Whitsuntide. * The chateau and its park. ==See also== *Communes of the Pas-de-Calais department ==References== Category:Communes of Pas-de-Calais
title: Airon-Saint-Vaast
